title: Understand ΔH° formula
text: To find the standard enthalpy change ΔH° for a reaction, use the formula:\nΔH° $$=$$ ∑(ΔH_f° products) - ∑(ΔH_f° reactants)

title: Calculate enthalpy of products
text:
Calculate the total enthalpy of the products using their formation enthalpies. Use the values given:
ΔH_f° NO₂ $$=$$ $$33.18$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
ΔH_f° H₂O $$=$$ $$-285.83$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
​
Remember, the reaction is:
N₂H₄(l) + $$3$$ O₂(g) → $$2$$ NO₂(g) + $$2$$ H₂O(l)

title: Calculate enthalpy of reactants
text: Calculate the total enthalpy of the reactants. Use:\nΔH_f° $$N_2 H_4=50.63$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$\n​ΔH_f° O₂ $$=$$ $$0$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$

title: Find ΔH° for the reaction
text: Now find the standard enthalpy change for the reaction using:\nΔH° $$=$$ ∑(ΔH_f° products) - ∑(ΔH_f° reactants)
